feature.name: Cache, override, identity attributes on function declaration
Enhancements on typed=lax for non-validating processors
Enhancements on function format-number (moved, but new formats)
Default collation enhancements (allowed on any element)
Recoverable errors do not exist anymore
Type attribute validation with complex types and copy/copy-of (XTTE1535)

test-set.name: expand-text
test-set.description: Tests the XSLT 3.0 expand-text attribute and content value templates

test-set.name: mode
test-set.description: Tests the use of modes in xsl:template and xsl:apply-templates

test-set.name: static
test-set.description: Tests static attributes on xsl:variable and xsl:param declarations

test-set.name: output
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:output declaration, and hence serialization generally

test-set.name: key
test-set.description: Test xsl:key and the key() function

test-set.name: normalize-unicode
test-set.description: Test the fn:normalize-unicode() function introduced in XPath 2.0, together with the normalization-form option on serialization.

test-set.name: resolve-uri
test-set.description: Tests resolve-uri() and other functionality related to resolution of relative URIs

test-set.name: apply-templates
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:apply-templates instruction. In practice, as indicated by the test names, most of the tests concern conflict resolution.

test-set.name: assert
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:assert instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0

test-set.name: xsl-document
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:document instruction, and construction of document nodes

test-set.name: construct-node
test-set.description: Tests instructions that create text, comment, processing-instruction etc nodes

test-set.name: evaluate
test-set.description: Tests xsl:evaluate, tests are dependent on the evaluation feature in 26.6 of the spec

test-set.name: iterate
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:iterate instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0

test-set.name: on-empty
test-set.description: Tests sequence constructors containing xsl:on-empty instructions

test-set.name: on-non-empty
test-set.description: Tests sequence constructors containing xsl:on-non-empty instructions

test-set.name: result-document
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:result-document instruction. Note: most of the tests concern serialization; very few actually generate multiple output documents.

test-set.name: sequence
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:sequence instruction and other expressions that construct sequences

test-set.name: stream
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:stream instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0. The tests in this section focus on variants of the xsl:stream instruction itself, and not on testing the streamability of its content.

test-set.name: bug
test-set.description: A collection of miscellaneous tests garnered from interesting bug reports

test-set.name: catalog
test-set.description: Tests that the test catalog is valid

test-set.name: error
test-set.description: Tests error conditions. This test set should include a test for every error code (however, coverage of new XSLT 3.0 errors is incomplete).

test-set.name: regex-classes
test-set.description: Tests regular expression character classes and Unicode blocks. The tests in this test-set may take a little time to execute...

test-set.name: xml-version
test-set.description: Tests support for XML 1.1. Note that the test catalog itself is an XML 1.0 document.

test-set.name: xp-striding-striding-consumingA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Striding, RS: Consuming Child axis on child or self axis with striding context selecting elements is striding and consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-striding-consumingB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Striding, RS: Consuming Self axis on child axis with striding context selecting elements is striding and consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Any step expression on empty selection is always grounded

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Step expressions child, namespace, attribute and descendant on a childless node kind selects nothing, is always grounded

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessC
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Self-axis that changes axes selects nothing, so grounded/motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessD
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Descendant-or-self on childless motionless nodes with different node type selects nothing, so grounded/motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessE
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless ancestor, parent, following, preceding etc axes on document node selects nothing, so grounded/motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessF
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Self axis on parent or ancestor axis which is not on U{element, document}} selects nothingness

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessG
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Self axis on ancestor-or-self axis which is not on U{element, document}} and not on same axis as lh side selects nothingness

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-motionlessH
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Motionless Ancestor-or-self axis not selecting U{element, document}} from self or ancestor-or-self axis selects nothing (if of unequal nodes), so grounded/motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-striding-motionlessA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Striding, RS: Motionless Self axis on self axis remains striding and motionless if both sides select the same nodes

test-set.name: xp-striding-climbing-motionlessA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Climbing, RS: Motionless Climbing axis parent, ancestor or ancestor-or-self on self or climbing axis is climbing and motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-climbing-motionlessB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Climbing, RS: Motionless Self axis on climbing axis, provided node type is same, inherits the climbing axis: climbing and motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-climbing-motionlessC
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Climbing, RS: Motionless Climbing axis attribute, namespace on self or climbing axis with U{element}} is climbing and motionless

test-set.name: xp-striding-climbing-consumingA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Climbing, RS: Consuming Attribute, namespace, parent or ancestor(-or-self) axis on child, descendant(-or-self) axis selecting elements is climbing and remains consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-climbing-consumingB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Climbing, RS: Consuming Parent or ancestor(-or-self) axis on child axis selecting non U{element, document}} is climbing and remains consuming, provided rh side selects U{element, document}

test-set.name: xp-striding-crawling-consumingA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Crawling, RS: Consuming A descendant(-or-self) axis on a child or descendant(-or-self) axis is crawling and consuming (scanning expression)

test-set.name: xp-striding-crawling-consumingB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Crawling, RS: Consuming A child axis on a descendant(-or-self) axis is crawling and consuming (scanning expression)

test-set.name: xp-striding-crawling-consumingC
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Crawling, RS: Consuming A self axis on a descendant(-or-self) axis is crawling and consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-consumingA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Consuming Attribute or namespace axis on child or descendant(-or-self) axis that is not in U{element}} is grounded (selects nothing) and remains consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-consumingB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Consuming Self axis selecting other node-type on child, descendant(-or-self) etc axis is grounded (selects nothing) and remains consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-grounded-consumingC
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Grounded, RS: Consuming Any axis with nodetest that never selects anything on a child or descendant(-or-self) axis is grounded (selects nothing) and remains consuming

test-set.name: xp-striding-roaming-free-rangingA
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Roaming, RS: Free-ranging Any step expression selecting streamed nodes on the following(-sibling) or preceding(-sibling) axis is roaming and free-ranging

test-set.name: xp-striding-roaming-free-rangingB
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Roaming, RS: Free-ranging Any step expression selecting streamed nodes on the following(-sibling) or preceding(-sibling) axis is roaming and free-ranging

test-set.name: xp-striding-roaming-free-rangingC
test-set.description: CP: Striding, RP: Roaming, RS: Free-ranging A child or descendant(-or-self) selection after a climbing expr that selects U{element, document}} is roaming/free-ranging

test-set.name: sf-codepoints-to-string
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:stream instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0 with fn:codepoints-to-string().

test-set.name: sf-distinct-values
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:stream instruction with distinct-values()

test-set.name: sf-fold-right
test-set.description: fold-right() function with streaming: the function is streamable if the operand is grounded, despite being processed from right-to-left: see bug 24125.

test-set.name: sf-index-of
test-set.description: Tests xsl:stream instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0 with xsl:result-document.

test-set.name: sf-snapshot
test-set.description: Tests the snapshot() function under streaming

test-set.name: sf-string-join
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:stream instruction with string-join()

test-set.name: si-apply-templates
test-set.description: Tests xsl:stream instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0 with xsl:apply-templates.

test-set.name: si-choose
test-set.description: xsl:choose and other conditional expressions with streaming

test-set.name: si-conditional-content
test-set.description: Tests xsl:stream instruction introduced in XSLT 3.0 with xsl:conditional-content.

test-set.name: sx-FunctionCall
test-set.description: Tests the xsl:stream instruction with calls to user-defined functions.

test-set.name: sx-MapExpr
test-set.description: XPath map{} constructor expression with streaming
